Topics: A statement that the study involves research
Questions:
Which of the following statements best describes the nature of the activity described in the consent form?
A) A routine medical procedure with no research component
B) A commercial promotion for indocyanine green (ICG)
C) A multicenter randomized controlled trial involving research
D) A voluntary survey without any medical intervention

Correct answer: C) A multicenter randomized controlled trial involving research

Topics: An explanation of the purposes of the research
The expected duration of the subject's participation
Questions:
How long will participants be involved in the Low vs Standard Dose Indocyanine Green study?
A) Up to 2 weeks; B) Up to 6 months; C) Up to 1 year; D) Indefinite period of time
Correct answer: A) Up to 2 weeks

Topics: Any additional costs to the subject that may result from participation in the research
Questions:
Which of the following statements is true regarding any additional costs to the subject for participating in the Low vs Standard Dose Indocyanine Green study?

A) Participants will be charged additional fees for the medical dye used in the study.
B) Participants will receive a stipend to cover any potential additional costs incurred.
C) There are no extra costs to participants for being involved in the study.
D) Participants must pay for the cost of surgery associated with the study.

Correct answer: C) There are no extra costs to participants for being involved in the study.

Topics: A description of the procedures to be followed
Questions:
What will happen if you agree to participate in the study regarding the dosage of indocyanine green (ICG) for near-infrared fluorescence imaging of biliary tract?

A) You will be given a fixed dose of ICG without any randomization.
B) You will be asked to choose between the standard dose and the lower dose of ICG.
C) You will be randomly assigned to receive either the standard dose or the lower dose of ICG by blindly drawing an envelope from a box.
D) You will be given both the standard dose and the lower dose of ICG in two separate surgeries.

Correct answer: C) You will be randomly assigned to receive either the standard dose or the lower dose of ICG by blindly drawing an envelope from a box.

Topics: The consequences of a subject's decision to withdraw from the research and procedures for orderly termination of participation by the subject
Questions:
What will happen if you choose to withdraw from the research study at any time?
A) You will be required to pay a penalty for early withdrawal; B) You will lose access to all medical care provided by the University of Florida; C) You will not face any penalty or loss of benefits you are entitled to; D) Your health insurance will be cancelled as a result of withdrawal.

Correct answer: C

Topics: Identification of any procedures which are experimental
The approximate number of subjects involved in the study
Questions:
How many participants are expected to be enrolled in the Low vs Standard Dose Indocyanine Green study?
A) 20; B) 35; C) 50; D) 100
Correct answer: B

Topics: A description of any reasonably foreseeable risks or discomforts to the subject
Questions:
What are the potential risks associated with the administration of indocyanine green (ICG) during the study?
A) Temporary discoloration of the skin; B) Mild allergic reactions such as itching or headache; C) Increased risk of long-term liver damage; D) Immediate improvement in bile duct visibility

Correct answer: B

Topics: A description of any benefits to the subject or to others which may reasonably be expected from the research
Questions:
What potential benefits might participants in the study experience from the use of a lower dose of Indocyanine Green (ICG) during surgery?
A) A higher risk of side effects
B) No change in the visualization of anatomy during surgery
C) Improved visualization of anatomy during surgery and a lower risk of side effects
D) Guaranteed improvement in post-surgical recovery

Correct answer: C) Improved visualization of anatomy during surgery and a lower risk of side effects

Topics: A disclosure of appropriate alternative procedures or courses of treatment, if any, that might be advantageous to the subject
Questions:
If you decide not to participate in the Low vs Standard Dose Indocyanine Green study, what standard procedure will you receive for your surgery?
A) You will receive a higher dose of a different medical dye for visualization; B) You will receive the standard visualization techniques as part of your regular care; C) You will not receive any form of visualization during your surgery; D) You will be given an experimental visualization technique not yet approved by the FDA.

Correct answer: B

Topics: A statement describing the extent, if any, to which confidentiality of records identifying the subject will be maintained

For research involving more than minimal risk, an explanation as to whether any compensation, and an explanation as to whether any medical treatments are available, if injury occurs and, if so, what they consist of, or where further information may be obtained
Questions:
If you experience an injury as a direct result of participating in this study, which of the following statements is true regarding compensation and medical treatment?
A) You will receive full compensation for all medical and hospital expenses.
B) Only professional services from University of Florida Health Science Center healthcare providers will be provided without charge.
C) You will receive a predetermined amount of monetary compensation for any injury.
D) All medical treatments, including those from external healthcare providers, will be covered by the study sponsor.

Correct answer: B) Only professional services from University of Florida Health Science Center healthcare providers will be provided without charge.

Topics: Research, Rights or Injury: An explanation of whom to contact for answers to pertinent questions about the research and research subjects' rights, and whom to contact in the event of a research-related injury to the subject
Questions:
If you experience an injury as a direct result of your participation in the study, who should you contact for assistance?
A) The insurance company; B) The Principal Investigator; C) The Institutional Review Board (IRB) office; D) A healthcare provider not associated with the study

Correct answer: B) The Principal Investigator

Topics: A statement that participation is voluntary, refusal to participate will involve no penalty or loss of benefits to which the subject is otherwise entitled, and the subject may discontinue participation at any time without penalty or loss of benefits, to which the subject is otherwise entitled
Questions:
What will happen if you decide not to participate in the Low vs Standard Dose Indocyanine Green study or if you choose to withdraw from the study at any time?

A) You will lose access to certain medical treatments that are only available to study participants.
B) You will face a penalty or lose benefits to which you are otherwise entitled.
C) You will not face any penalty or lose benefits to which you are otherwise entitled, and your standard care will continue.
D) Your decision will be kept confidential and will not affect your future medical care.

Correct answer: C) You will not face any penalty or lose benefits to which you are otherwise entitled, and your standard care will continue.
